description: The heavily redacted report focuses on an August altercation at Arlington National Cemetery involving two campaign staffers for former President Donald Trump and a cemetery employee.
title: Army releases report about Trump campaign incident at Arlington National Cemetery

description: A conservative appeals court sided with Republicans in ruling against a Mississippi law that allows election officials to count mail ballots that are postmarked by Election Day but arrive after it.
title: Appeals court sides with GOP on Miss. law that provides grace period for mail ballots

description: Lesh, an original member of America's preeminent jam band, died Friday morning.
title: The Grateful Dead bassist Phil Lesh dies at 84

description: The U.S. Justice Department says it has foiled at least four assassination attempts tied to foreign powers in recent years. They're part of a trend of governments attempting to silence their critics overseas. We hear from the target of one of those assassination plots, which was allegedly orchestrated by an Indian intelligence official.
title: An Alleged Assassination Attempt By an Indian Spy on U.S. Soil

description: Officials in Lancaster County in the swing state of Pennsylvania say they identified hundreds of potentially fraudulent voter registration applications.
title: Pennsylvania county halts hundreds of potentially fraudulent voter registration forms

description: Jones, who began his singing career in the 1950s and was a frequent guest on the popular romantic comedy TV show, died after a battle with leukemia.
title: Grammy-winning crooner Jack Jones, known for singing 'The Love Boat' theme, dies at 86

description: How do you encourage women to report domestic violence? In one Pakistani city, there's a new strategy: sending in female cops on pink scooters.
title: She says her husband tried to kill her. Enter the 'Pink Wheels' squad

description: DNA tests identified a skull found during home renovations in 1978 as that of an Indiana teen who died after childbirth in 1866. Authorities say Esther Granger was likely the victim of grave robbing.
title: An Indiana teen died in 1866. How did her skull end up in an Illinois house's walls?

description: Jon and Carie Hallford were accused of taking money from customers and a pandemic relief fund and spending it on travel, plastic surgery and expensive cars.
title: Owners of ‘horrific’ funeral home plead guilty to federal fraud charges

description: A judge ruled that Virginia violated a federal law by systematically purging registered voters too close to this fall’s election. Republican Gov. Glenn Youngkin says the state is appealing.
title: A judge orders Virginia to restore registered voters purged too close to Election Day

description: Maj. Gen. Christopher Beck said peers described Sarah Roque "as tough and proud of everything she did and proud to serve our country, which she did with honor and distinction."
title: Body of missing 23-year-old Army sergeant is found in a dumpster on Missouri base

description: It is the latest in a series of Israeli attacks against journalists covering the war in Gaza and Lebanon in the past year.
title: Israeli strike in Lebanon kills 3 journalists

description: Sulhee Jessica Woo, author of a new cookbook, "Let's Make Some Lunch," shares healthy, fun and creative meals that can be prepared in 30 minutes or less.
title: PB&J again? Banish lunchbox boredom with these 6 kid-approved recipes

description: Settling Gaza is not Israel’s official policy. But prominent politicians took part in a pro-settlement rally Monday, and some see possibility in what recently appeared to be a far-fetched proposition.
title: Israeli settlers in Gaza? Netanyahu’s allies lay out a strategy

description: In Texas, Vice President Harris will call attention to abortion rights. Beyoncé will also make a guest appearance to perform. And, Biden to issue historic apology to Native Americans while in Arizona.
title: Harris to call attention to abortion rights. And, Biden to issue historic apology.

description: Last Halloween, the FDA said that some cinnamon, a spice loved by many kids and adults, was contaminated with lead, a metal that can cause irreversible damage in babies and young children.
title: Lead in cinnamon: Where do things stand, 1 year after a scary recall?

description: As more states ban gender care for youth, doctors and clinics in Minnesota are building up capacity to help the influx of trans patients who are traveling or moving to the state for care.
title: Minnesota is a refuge for trans health care. Here's how doctors are meeting the need

description: In this week's StoryCorps, a man from Briton remembers his first Halloween in America.
title: For his first Halloween in the U.S., British man takes a stab at scare acting

description: The four-page letter addressed to Attorney General Merrick Garland calls on the department to investigate potential crimes committed by Israeli soldiers and civilians and is a rare instance of public disagreement inside the department.
title: DOJ lawyers slam 'glaring gap' in failure to investigate potential Israeli crimes

description: Election officials say ballot drop boxes are a secure and accessible way for voters to return mail ballots, but they've also been the subject of numerous attacks from Donald Trump and his allies.
title: Ballot drop boxes are often the subject of false claims. Here's what to know

description: Biden visits Arizona on Friday to apologize for the horrors of the federal Indian boarding schools that ran for over 150 years, and also trumpet the administration's policies to help Native American communities.
title: Biden promised to visit a Native American tribe. He's finally going, in a swing state

description: The success of Silent Hill 2, and the announcement of several other projects, begs the question: How serious is Konami about revitalizing its most beloved franchises?
title: ‘Silent Hill 2’ is a hit. That’s good news for Konami as it returns to the classics

description: How does one write a not-offensively blithe question about accusations of fascism? This week's quiz walks that ethical tightrope.
title: This week's quiz includes the word 'beclown' (if that's even a real word)

description: Three NASA astronauts and a Russian cosmonaut splashed down off the Florida coast early Friday, capping a nearly eight-month science and research mission to the International Space Station.
title: NASA’s Crew-8 mission members return to Earth on SpaceX capsule

description: A California-based produce company was the source of fresh onions linked to a deadly E. coli food poisoning outbreak at McDonald’s, restaurant chain officials said.
title: McDonald's says onions from California-based company are linked to E. coli outbreak
